title: Great practice
body:
I found a excellent and professional team, very helpful answers regarding of my cataract operation.After operation to my first eye I see perfect and I can't wait the second operation. A great Thank you  all.
SpaMedica-Romford , Evolutio, Specsavers

title: unable to contact, unhelpful
body: fairly elderly with not extensive online skills. I was referred to 2 local hospital pain management clinics some time ago. I have had a private diagnosis which I sent to my practice. I have been instructed today to also send copies to the 2 pain clinics. I am not in good health mentally and physically and was upset to be asked(told) in a phone call from a dr to send copies in this way. This is GP practice's job! the implication was that if I didn't do it it wouldn't get done.Disgusted! this is beyond my capabilities and I shouldn't be told to do it .when not able to cope

title: Unfair and unclear change to patient parking
body: This recent change to car parking has not been well communicated to those that hire rooms to run clinics. Please note that non GP appointments bypass reception and go upstairs.  The need to register to park has caught many unaware including my clinician who holds regular clinics but now looking elsewhere.  Fines are punitive and system overly officious for a free car park for patients use. Sets completely wrong tone and causes unnecessary anxiety at times when many are vulnerable and unwell.

title: Very empathetic doctors
body: I have found all of the doctors in the Garth surgery very thoughtful in their response to my concerns, whether physical or mental health.

title: Reception not helpfull
body: I phoned as I have been suffering a skin problem for a couple of years that had worsened and had a couple of soars that wouldn't clear up ,and still hasn't.I was promptly told it was not life threatening and that they were busy .I am a 74 year old women and was very upset at her response and I might add I very rarely visit the surgery .All I wanted was to find out what the problem was.

title: Fantastic people
body: Having moved from a heavily populated area to gnosall 16 years ago the change in healthcare has been amazing.  I feel like I’m the luckiest person having a fantastic team looking after my health. I honestly cannot fault them. I’ve had a health condition from birth and for decades have been brushed aside yet since being at gnosall it has been diagnosed and now the condition is in the past

title: Exceptional service and treatment
body: I cannot fault the level of care, attention and service that my lovely father received from the nursing team and doctors on ward 405 at RDH. They were extremely attentive and kind. Thanks The doctors even phoned me to update me on my dad’s condition. My family and I are very grateful.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Just a bunch of special people
body:
I won’t name anyone specifically, just wanted to say how amazed and grateful I am for everyone working in the REI. Everyone I saw was kind and professional. That’s from reception, who have the patience of the angels, through to the opticians.

I know how busy it’s been but nothing felt rushed and the person I saw was spectacular in the effort they have put in to get my vision to be the best it can. I’m just so grateful that they’re there. Thank you.

title: Car park
body:
My husband visited your surgery this morning, to find the car park full and overflowing., he is 77 and not in great health and  he had to park a long way down the next street with a long walk back to the surgery, only to find that there was only one person in the waiting room. In the half an hour that he was waiting only two people came out from the doctors. What is going wrong? are random people parking there and taking up the spaces? What happens when disabled people want to park and have no spaces. Isn't it about time you had a numberplate system in the reception to make sure that only patients can use the car park. 

Also can you get the monotonous music thats played when you are on hold changed. I am sure that many people feel the same.

title: Worthy of 5 stars on Trust Pilot
body: I was a patient on ward C4 following a hemi glossectomy.  The nursing staff made my 10 day stay a delight!  The level of care was unsurpassable; their teamwork faultless whilst all the time maintaining  a great sense of humour.  The food was pretty good too (when I got around to being able to eat!).

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent,  knowledgeable and professional staff
body:
After admission via Ed and aau, I was in the care of 31a, cardiology. 
The staff were amazing, working long hours under difficult and changing circumstances. Bays throughout my stay went from green to amber,  and this was not easy for staff or patients,  but the great care continued  despite covids best efforts   well done everyone

title: Room for improvement
body: The doctors and nurses are nice but it does take ALOT of time and effort to finally get through to reception. I understand they are busy, but it is ridiculous. How on earth are we as working people ment to hold on line for hearly 1 hour to finally get through to someone on reception? Sometimes after holding for over 50 minutes you get cut off! I feel that the have taken on way too many patients on

title: Health Centre pretty good before Modality, now…
body:
My Health Centre was pretty good before being sucked into Modality Partnership.
Prescription Service worked well, making appointments worked OK.
Now, prescriptions are dealt with centrally and pharmacist appears to override GP prescription.
In December wanted to make an appointment for late January  only to be told that they were not making any appointments at all and to call back in January.
Since Modality took over the service has gone downhill and is now very poor.  If we were to become ill we would go to A&E.
Dreadful and the really sad thing is we have no alternative.

title: Good Practice
body: I received a follow up call to monitor my condition. There was a thorough discussion covering all angles of the issues.

title: Fantastic receptionists
body: Just been in the surgery for my husband to get his blood pressure checked.While we were there we witnessed the receptionists managing some very different calls and enquiries. They were very polite and patient in very difficult circumstances.

title: Wonderful practice
body:
I’ve been a patient of Phgh For nearly 30 years
Since Covid I believe the practice has been exemplary not only in delivering the vaccine but the wonderful doctors and nurses have been there to support me throughout 
When I need to see a doctor they see me if not they have a wonderful system of calling you and prescribing or asking you to go in if necessary this is handled seamlessly and effectively this saves a lot of time and the surgery when you enter is not as busy I hope this service stays the same because I think it is working brilliantly 
I feel very privileged to be a member of the surgery

title: Excellent
body:
I attended the Evolutio clinic in Wetbourne. Bournemouth. The practitioners were very thorough and I was seen without any delays.
I previously had a video appointment which was very helpful.

title: Excellent Practice
body: I have been with the practice for 8 years now, even through this pandemic the service I have received has been extremely well managed, I not only need appts for myself but sometimes have my disabled mother that needs appts..the practice always are very welcoming and try their upmost best to accommodate mine and my mothers needs to see the doctors and nursing staff when needed. The practice always follow up with us if any abnormalities should show up with our health..I can't thank them enough for all the support they give us...

title: Eternally grateful
body:
Emergency service, Paramedics, trauma doctor and the trauma team saved my husband’s life after a DIY accident involving a circular saw. They worked tirelessly to save his hand and arm and we are now in a position where he is receiving great rehabilitation care and support for his injuries.
I am eternally grateful and continually  overwhelmed by the level of skill and expertise we have here at James Cook University Hospital that saved my husband’s life. 
Thank you all from the bottom of my heart

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful Practice
body:
I would like to offer my sincere thanks to all members of staff at Weeping Cross. 
During these difficult times I have had cause to contact the GP surgery for some issues and I have to admit that I have had more than my usual share of anxiety throughout the pandemic. 
I have been treated with compassion and patience at every stage and I am so grateful to all of you. 
Every member of staff has been kind, patient and thoroughly helpful whenever I have telephoned or visited the surgery. 
These have been the most difficult of times for everyone but I have never been made to feel like a nuisance or made to feel that I was wasting the clinicians time. I have been able to see a doctor when there was a need and I have received wonderful care. 

I thank you all from the bottom of my heart for your understanding and compassion. 
You have all been super stars and I am so grateful to be a patient at this surgery.

title: Day Care Unit Superb
body: Fantastic from arrival to departure.Staff so polite and helpful.Chair in my bay was made 20 stone .6ft + man was not suitable ,for average person.

readBy.name: James Paget University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good practice
body: I found the staff to be very attentive, responsive, friendly, polite and heplful. Thank you Brooke surgery.

title: Very disappointing
body: Very long wait behind people with appointments.  Very few staff apparently working in Primary Care.  Waited well over two hours and often there was only me in the waiting area.  I didn’t feel supported by the NHS.  Disappointed the review process doesn’t allow a full description of my treatment.

title: Car Parking
body: I visited the hospital due to being in severe pain.  The hospital was very busy which I appreciate.  Could not fault the staff .  The issue I have is with the car parking.  I was in the hospital for 4 hours and 6 minutes.  If I had been just under the 4 hours I would have been charged £6.00.  For the time over the 4 hours, I was charged the equivalent of £1.00 per minute.  This is disgraceful and cannot see how this is justifiable.  I am sure a lot of patients will be in the hospital for over 4 hours when busy, there should be another band of fee for up to 5 or 6 hours.  £12.00 charge for 4 hours and 6 minutes is disgusting - even more so when you are in severe pain.  People who park at the hospital do not do so for fun.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Fantastic Hospital and staff
body: My husband had to go into A&E at Darenth Valley Hospital, he is elderly, confused and wheelchair bound. From the first moment we arrived we received the most outstanding care all delivered with enormous kindness, consideration and warmth. Within four hours, all investigations were done and he was on a drip with a ward allocated. Oak ward has continued to match the first class service received in A&E and again the kindness and consideration of all the doctors and nurses is quite simply outstanding. Fabulous hospital with Fabulous staff. Thank you Darenth Valley.

title: Stay away
body: One of the doctors doesn’t care about his patients and seems to have lost the passsion for looking after people. When I was younger he seemed to be nice and care about people. I have been ill off work for 3 weeks unpaid. I have been diagnosed with a almost inactive thyriod. Have had severe cramps and exhaustion over the last 3 weeks. I have had a blood test to be told there normal and nothing he can do. I’m like what I still feel completely exhaust and I’m supposed to tell my employer sorry I’ve been off but apparently I’m absolutely fine. Honestly don’t go there

title: Fabulous practice
body: From the time I checked in for my double bunion surgery until  the time i was wheeled to the car. all i received  was the very best care i was treated with empathy dignity and love they were so very kind. Very happy that they are looking after me while I am recovering from  surgery .

title: 5 Star Review
body: I requested a continued sick note on the phone and was told I needed to give a 5 star review on the surgery website in order to recieve my note.

title: Fantastic Hospital and staff
body: My husband had to go into A&E at Darenth Valley Hospital, he is elderly, confused and wheelchair bound. From the first moment we arrived we received the most outstanding care all delivered with enormous kindness, consideration and warmth. Within four hours, all investigations were done and he was on a drip with a ward allocated. Oak ward has continued to match the first class service received in A&E and again the kindness and consideration of all the doctors and nurses is quite simply outstanding. Fabulous hospital with Fabulous staff. Thank you Darenth Valley.

title: Quality Service
body: Really caring doctors and staff who are genuinely interested in helping you through the whole process of improved health and wellbeing. Thank you.

title: Helpful and efficient
body: I’ve had frequent need to contact you recently for one of my children. You have always accommodated an urgent call, whatever time of day and never feel like we’re bothering you too much. Thanks for all the work you do

title: Wonderfull place clean and very friendly
body: From the person who took me from reception to the wards couldnt have been better everyone was so kind and very very caring l have never been to a hospital where I was so relaxed it was all down to the wonderfull staff .

title: What a lovely experience
body: I visited Leap Valley Surgery today and I was blown away by the pleasant experience and how friendly and lovely the staff were. They were all extremely helpful, caring and attentive.

title: Amazing team
body: Went to the breast surgery service today, it was amazing, the consultant was so friendly and approachable, all the nurses were so lovely and professional and it was just a non stressful experience, you were all amazing.Whoever moans about the NHS have obviously never dealt with them.

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body: When I have contacted this practice or had a consultation with a doctor, I have found people professional, helpful, friendly and efficient. My experiences and various contacts have been seamless from registration to consultation and I would struggle to find anything to criticise. Yes, people do seem to be very busy and many staff do seem to be under pressure, but presumably that's because they're working hard to help and support many patients. In the context of covid particularly, they all seem to be doing remarkably well. The practice should know that there are a great many people who appreciate the great work that you do. Thank you.”

title: Local hospital
body: I had to get a blood test done today I entered the department booked myself in and just say down when a voice called but could not hear what was said I asked other patients waiting if they had heard the name and they replied no then all of a sudden a very aggressive roar came out calling my name when I entered the area called into I apologised for not coming the first call and explained that the name called could not be heard the person taking the bloods was very aggressive in manners and in my opinion of she had got off her seat to the end of the department her voice would have carried down to the waiting area she was very abrupt with me bruised me and left my arm bleeding when I got back to my car the blood was all down my arm into my crutch handle surely they could have waited to see if I had stopped as for her name calling what if I had an hearing aid and was hard of hearing it would have been worse would she have come out to call me in the waiting area I've never been treated like this before I shall be asking my go not to refer me there again so disappointed in the service and treat ment

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Efficient, caring and always professional
body:
Receptionists always listen and arrange a triage appointment usually on the same day if required. Good judgment and efficient service. There are telephone queues but this is to be expected under the current climate. Have a little patience as the queuing system reduces quite quickly and really is no hardship. 
I always feel valued and listened too by my GP practice appointments are promptly made if an examination is required. Usually very satisfied with the advise and course of action given. 
I have been registered at Wychall Lane Surgery for over 32 years and at times have needed urgent care and quick thinking decisions for me and members of my family from my experiences past and present I have always been impressed with the dedication and professionalism shown by everyone working 
at this practice. Thank you 😊

title: Cataract treatment
body: Brilliant experience today - procedure quick and smooth with confident surgeon - l felt so relaxed 🙂👍

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Thank for looking after my Mum.
body:
My mum was admitted via A and E. Sadly she was diagnosed to be end of life.
She was treated with the upmost dignity and respect by all members of staff, from the A and E consultants to the Heath care assistants.
In this difficult time for us all we were given access to be with my Mum as a family which was so appreciated. She was transferred to Afu where again we were kept informed by the consultant and her team by telephone and in person about my Mum. Sadly my Mum passed away peacefully and we were able to be with her. We also received a card a few days later from the ward which was very kind.
It’s been a very difficult time for the NHS during covid and I wanted to take this opportunity to share my family’s experience. Thank you and please pass on out thanks.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Calm efficient sympathetic care
body: I had a cataract operation recently. All the staff were brisk and efficient but caring. The surgeon himself was jolly and entertaining while doing his work and I really appreciated him joking with me beforehand to ease the tension and fear I had around undergoing the procedure. The chief nurse was just lovely and so was the trainee nurse who used to be a fisherman - what a wonderful thing to retrain in. There was a very slight delay in sedation but as soon as that happened things were underway and I was never made to feel like a cissy for needing it. I am just amazed that other people do not need it. World class service from world people. Long Live the NHS! No to privatisation!

title: Great care
body:
My dad was at Castletroy for three years before he passed away. He received really good care, both physically and mentally. The staff were always kind to both him and his family, he was always clean, hair cut, shaved and tidy.
There was always entertainment going on for the residents to keep them stimulated.
Dad was really content during his time there and I would highly recommend this care home

title: No problem
body: I had a smear test I was extremely anxious regards to this.  I was called in to my appointment met by a friendly nurse who put me at ease straight away she explained very well regards to why we need smears and what results could mean when they come back.  Procedure was fine I don’t know what I was panicking about.

title: Worst A&E ever
body:
From rude staff, no compassion sympathy or empathy what so ever!
I’m from out of area but attended with my partner after an accident.  Went through 111 first given a number that should have been to stop having to go through everything time and time again to be told I don’t know what’s up with you that’s just a number to me! 
Then triage with 5 members of staff in the smallest room being uninterested, no checks no pain scoring or offer of pain relief! They then say go sit in the waiting room it’s at least 5 hours but will go up! The impression I got was to put you off waiting!
Every member of staff in the department seriously need to reconsider their job choices! If you don’t care don’t be in a caring profession!

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Was given an appointment with GP the same day I called. Receptionist was polite and helpful. Subsequent visit to see the Nurse   in Feb and again appointment was given at a time to suit me by the same polite & helpful receptionist. The Nurse was lovely & very patient. On both visits I was very satisfied.

title: Good Doctors surgery
body: Was seen by GP yesterday she was patient with me listened to what i had to say and generally was very empathetic towards me which makes a face to face consultation more comfortable ,huge thankyou to my GP

title: Terrible
body: I phoned at half past 8 extremely unwell with a kidney infection and was told there was no appointments! I phoned back 10 mins later and spoke to a different receptionist who put me on an emergency list to speak to a doctor.  I waited 7 hours by the time I had a call back after phoning the sugery back early afternoon to say how poorly I felt and needed antibiotics I was told I was "on the list" finally got to speak to a nurse who gave me antibiotics and told me to get a sample to the practice so my dad took.one one down only to be told they couldn't take it and to submit another on Monday morning as it was a Friday! To feel soo poorly and not get to speak to anyone for 7 hours is frightening. Feel completely let down 😪

title: Great service from both your practices
body:
I spoke to one of your admin today as ı was moved onto you from the forest practice and remember his kindness as he would sound like a 'doctor'. ı am now living in E15 and ı recognise him. 
I am now registered with your health centre and the service ı get is phenomenal. I was told he is the main member of the team from him and ı loved his assistance with walm welcomes. I was given a referral to the hospital by the GP and he was able to print my booking reference and access code for me so ı knew what to do in hand. I told him he looked very smart dressed say thank you

title: Cataract removal
body: I was very impressed with the level of service I received. The staff were really helpful and very kind. The surgeon was really good at telling me what was happening and was very reassuring and charming.

title: Frustrated with the service
body: A doctor in the Gynecology department gave me a list of blood tests to do and asked me to contact my GP to get those done; however, there are some tests that the GP surgery cannot perform and I confirmed it twice with two different GP's. I contacted the secretary in the Gynecology department and they said to contact my GP and get the test done. But that specific blood test cannot be performed at the surgery as I have been informed on several occasions by both the receptionists and the GP's themselves. I am stuck in this loop and have not been able to contact my Gynecologist to give me a straight answer as to where to get the blood test done that they have asked me to do. According to my GP the blood test has to be done in the hospital.

title: Fantastic treatment
body: Had a full hip replacement, the whole process from assessment/ pre op, surgery, care on ward etc was absolutely faultless, fantastic care and lovely staff throughout. Would highly recommend , this was my other hip being replaced ( first five years previous) and had amazing ‘service’ then but this was second to none.Highly recommend.

title: Very good service
body: I tested positive for covid and received a call within 24 hours to check that I was ok and offering regular calls. This was was wonderfully comforting and encouraging - I just want to say a huge thank you

title: Mixed experience
body:
The hospital has minimal signage and no maps so I struggled to find the department I needed when I arrived. The receptionist refused to let me book my follow-up and told me I had to call bookings the next day.

The Dr was thorough and came up with a plan with me. The treatment started on the same visit. The only thing was that after the procedure I was sat in this empty room and felt a bit forgotten about and wasn't sure if I could leave and what to do.

title: Day Surgery Unit - First Class Care
body: Had double bunion surgery yesterday and received outstanding care.  Everything organised amazingly.  Nursing, surgeon and theatre staff were exceptional.  The after care in recovery was attentive and dedicated and I had the same lovely nurse all through.  I went home with all the information I needed for aftercare.  I cannot Praise the treatment received any higher.  It was relaxed and welcoming and above all I felt I was in wonderful hands.  Thank you everyone.

title: Fantastic treatment
body: Had total hip replacement, the treatment from  appointment phone calls, pre op assessment, surgery, staff care , etc was absolutely amazing. Highly recommend. Opposite hip replaced 5 years previous at same practice , excellent ‘ service’ then but this was second to none. Nothing was too much trouble in all departments, cannot praise everyone enough. Thank you,  one and all .

title: Rude receptionist
body: Attended A&E last night on GP referral.  The booking in receptionist seated behind the glass on duty around 7.30 pm was very rude and abrasive.  I do not want the entire waiting room hearing my personal and medical details.  That aside the attitude was awful - why be front facing if you don’t like communicating with people.  When people attend A&E it’s because they need help and are feeling vulnerable - please ensure reception staff have the right skill set to be front facing.  If they don’t have people skills  (colleagues can surely hear the tone and attitude used) maybe they should have back office duties only.  The receptionist job is to sit there greet people and book them in so I fail to see the reason this receptionist was so unpleasant and so rude.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: So disappointed
body: After months of trying to see my GP and endless phone calls, to be given a appointment with a GP l have not seen, l cannot fault the GP he was very thorough. After discussing my symptoms he referred me as an emergency for tests at the hospital within two weeks. I had a phone call from the hospital the day after, l was seen a week after, a week after that l received a text message from the doctor who referred me to the hospital saying l had a medical condition and to phone the surgery to arrange an appointment. I phoned several times, eventually got through to be told all appointments had been taken,l asked if l could make an appointment with my GP No was the answer as my own GP was booked until the end of February. I was told to keep trying !!!!!! No l have not yet seen a GP and l have given up trying.

title: Excellent practice
body: I had complex cataract surgery on my right eye on 26/1/22. From the time I arrived I received excellent treatment snd re-assurance from all staff members from reception to nurses,theatre staff and brilliant surgeon.Thankyou to everyone who took care of me that day at Sparmedica Bristol I will be back for cataract surgery on left eye soon.

title: Great team work.
body: Yet again i have been very well looked after , from the initial appointment with the Consultant through to my procedures with the Endoscopy team. I’m sure the last couple of years have been very stressful for all hospital staff but i couldn’t have been treated any better. A big thank you to everyone.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic care
body:
I had shoulder surgery as a day case but had to stay in as I wasn’t well enough to go home the same day.
The staff, from the domestic staff to the consultants, we’re absolutely lovely. Very attentive, caring and so kind. I couldn’t fault anything in the way they looked after me. The Friarage is an amazing hospital with amazing staff who need to be recognised for their hard work.

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Care
body: From beginning of entering A/E and going through( over four days) ending in AMU 1&2 …. I had wonderful dedicated care and treatment . I witnessed staff working in such busy, stressful and hard situations and they still managed smiles and were always there to help.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Needs to improve
body:
GPs do not do face to face consultations relying on econsult which may be acceptable with minor problems but patients should be able to get face to face appointments now. Patients gave to go through a triage system and are often given an appointment with a nurse and cannot get to see a GP. It sometimes takes two weeks to get blood test results. I have recently moved just out of area and the difference between Upper Gordon Road Surgery and my new surgery is immense. I am now able to see a GP, sometimes the same day, treatment and referrals are very prompt, results come back
within a few days and the service given is exceptional. If some GP surgeries can give this service why not all?

title: Time to close! Not fit to run as a surgery
body: One GP in particular is the worst example of how to not care for your patients and make them feel insignificant. During consultation I was told I could have emailed my concerns! After being at this surgery for many years and having exceptional care from some of the old GP’s who have either retired or left the practice. It is no longer fit for purpose. You are locked out of the surgery and can only come in If you have an appointment. So in theory any queries have to be phoned in and you are in a queue for on occasions over an hour plus! You can only have a face to face according the the receptionist if the GP deems it necessary post a telephone consultation. I have no idea what this service is that they are offering armed with rude GPs and a limited number of receptionist that know what they are doing I would not recommend anyone joining this practise and fear there will be big catastrophe with patients health if there is no intervention with how this service is being run! I have so many experiences of awful care/service from them. Where they don’t do what they say they will do. Putting patient health at risk. Not appropriate to list here. But sufficient to drive me to write this after years of being with this surgery. They do not listen to hear! They are not fit to be called a surgery and need closing down.

title: Good service
body:
I just want to balance the other terrible reviews, I know people only usually write reviews when something goes wrong.

A couple of months ago I rang the practice to discuss a couple of problems, I rang at 2pm and was in with the doctor by 4pm.

This week I rang, again about 2pm and had a telephone consultation with the GP the next day, followed by a chat with the pharmacist.

All the staff are friendly and helpful. I know you can wait a while on the phone sometimes but it's little different to waiting in a queue at reception - just more comfortable. I moved to this surgery several years ago because of problems with another in the town and am really pleased that I changed.

title: So kind
body: Thank-you to the nurse on the desk, and the nurse I saw ( appointment @9.20 on 5th February) I didn't have to wait and the nurse I saw was really friendly and kind,  thank-you it was really appreciated.

readBy.name: Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent Partnership NHS Trust

title: Wrong Number
body:
Luckily I haven't needed GP services for some time, but phoned today to hopefully make an appointment ASAP. Pre Covid reception was open till 1pm (NHS site & GP site still list 1pm) but now till 11.30am (not sure what website I found this info on) I missed by a few minutes. 
However the automated message left info on out of hours GP services which I called.
Unfortunately the number was for the Westminster Vaccination Help Line.
I know NHS services are under a lot of strain but they should triple check automated messages contain the correct information before hand.
I then tried to book an appointment online but have totally forgotten my log in details and you can only get them from from the GP surgery.
The GP website also states that out of hours calls will redirect you to out of hours service which it no longer does.
My options are 
A) wait till Monday to arrange a call back & then hopefully be offered a same day appointment- difficult as I have to work if well enough.
B) try to get to a walk in centre - my nearest is a good ten mins walk from public transport which could be difficult bearing in mind my symptoms.
C) Go to A&E which is nearer.
D) Speak to chemist who won't be able to prescribe medication but offer if available/ suitable  over the counter meds.
E) find a private GP and pay, which I can't afford.......
A mistake in putting up the wrong phone number adds lots of stress to patients situations. Especially as a few minutes chat with out of hours service would calm my nerves and if required provide advice on what to do next regarding medication if deemed suitable, check ups to consider etc

title: Helpful Operational Manager
body: The operational manager that was dealing with my request on the afternoon of 03.02.22, at the Welling branch of the practice, 'went the extra mile'. I was having difficulty obtaining my blood test result, which I was anxious about. She followed this up and was able to obtain the result. She then communicated the result to me in a timely fashion. Thank you!

author: neptunepj53
title: Going to rehab and changing my life once and for all
body: In prison rehab came up. I've been given the chance to go to another as when I was first released I went to Ark House. Stephanie went above and beyond to find me a different placement which I really appreciate.

author: Shuffle Bucket
title: I’d be lost without her.
body: Bev was lovely for my blood test. and considerate as always. She is fab and I’d be lost without her. I think she’s always professional and has the patients’ interest at heart. Thank you Bev. I have MS & you always put me at ease in my wheelchair. HUGE THANK YOU 😁

title: Disappointed.
body: My overall experience was welcoming I was disappointed that I was unable to have procedure at your Hospital I am now on 2 year wating with NHS. I had the impression that this Hospital took NHS Patients it seems not be the case. It only takes private patients or Urgent cases.

title: GPS fantastic
body:
The gps here are truly fantastic 
However although there are some great admin and receptionists sometimes some of them are abrupt and unhelpful. This can be upsetting and frustrating and can have a detrimental effect on trying to get help. Especially where mental illness is concerned.  Once speaking to drs they cannot do enough to help
It’s just a shame I get nervous if I have to phone the surgery as I don’t know what response I’m going to get

title: Avoid
body:
Doctors are great, reception is OK depending on who you get.
The biggest issue is that when you are prescribed something you have to wait days for it to be sent to a pharmacy.
I have a little girl and every time she is ill and I leave it until the evening to collect my perscription they tell me its not been sent. So I have to wait and watch my little girl in pain for sometimes days until the perscription is sent. So angry this has happened again so I'll be moving surgery tomorrow to avoid this.

title: Wonderful Care
body:
I was in the Acute Cardiology Unit for a few days January, the care I was given was amazing, nothing was too much trouble. Thank you to you all.
Yesterday I attended the Cardiac Catheter Suite, where I was fitted with a pacemaker, once again the staff were so caring, I was very nervous, but everybody in the unit were so kind the nurses, surgeon, theatre staff, they just put my mind at rest. I just want to say, a big thank you to you all,on both units. You really are very special people. Thank you once again Joy Craigie

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: My husband used the NHS app to order his repeat prescription for the first time this week. We were a bit unsure as to whether it would work, but it did, and the prescriptions were ready within 24 hours. Thank you very much.

title: Great patient care
body: I have received and continue to receive empathetic and exemplary care from my doctor(s). They listen and are very helpful. If they think you are in need of specialist care they refer you to the relevant authority.

title: Very caring efficient practice
body: I have had to have constant care from the Nurses of the practise and on every visit, seeing often different Nurses, I have found them very caring.  I have had minimal waiting time and once in for my dressings etc. I had the feeling that there was all the time in the world to deal with me.  My Doctor has been on call and consulted frequently and when necessary I could speak to him.

title: Fantastic place
body: From start to finish the treatment was great,everything was explained and to be able to see a physiotherapist then get a scan and a cortisone injection and given exercises to do at home and booked in for meetings on line and all done in one place on the same afternoon was fantastic

title: Great experience getting booster vaccination
body: I just wanted to pass on my appreciation of how smooth the process of getting my COVID booster vaccination was at Hightown Surgery. Everyone was very efficient and helpful, and the whole process took less than 10 minutes. I know this kind of thing is often taken for granted, so I felt it was important to let everyone involved know that their efforts are very much appreciated.

title: Really impressed!
body:
After calling 111 on a Saturday afternoon and explaining my symptoms, I was advised to call St George Urgent Treatment Centre to speak with a nurse. The first time I called, the line was busy, so the call dropped and I had to dial again. The second time I called, my call went straight through, and I spoke with a very nice receptionist. She took down my information and said that a nurse practitioner would call me at some point that afternoon. Twenty minutes later, I got a call from the nurse practitioner, who was straight-to-the-point but friendly, and he explained that he would send off a prescription for me to pick up at the pharmacy about 30 minutes later. He called me back to confirm that the prescription had been ordered and he advised me to call back or make an appointment with my GP if my symptoms didn't improve. 

Overall great experience. Thank you!

title: Upsetting experience
body: I received a letter from the practice with an invitation and appointment for a health review. When I attended the GP did not know anything about it and seemed not to know what was expected. I said I had queries and was told I had better get on with them as time was short. Nothing appeared to fall within the GP’s remit e.g. referrals for physio, memory loss. Much of the advice given was common sense. A review was carried out but only because I pushed. At the end of the appointment I said I was disappointed. After a lack of face to face appointments for some time due to covid and the fact it was supposed to be a medical review appointment I had expected more. At the end of the appointment the door was shut in my face when I was still speaking. I would not recommend this practice despite the fact that the receptionists are very sweet. A very unprofessional doctor and an upsetting experience all round.

title: Wonderful treatment/staff
body:
I was brought in as emergency having suffered a complete heart block! Was admitted to Dryden Ward was in CCU2 bed4…… the treatment I received by all the nursing staff on ward was second to none! I was very frightened and was put at ease and couldn’t have had better treatment anywhere. Leading up to my having a pacemaker fitted on 11th. I would like to thank all of the nurses and staff concerned. I was 300miles away from home when taken Ill, I am at home now thanks to them.
Food was also second to none…..which helps to a good recovery….
Thanx again everyone

title: Superb service
body: Everything.  And I  have been referred as I was informed and the appointment has come through today. Very efficient

title: Poor follow up
body:
I have been calling pilgrim gp since many months.always the line is busy.
The doctor told he will get back regarding my son skin condition.its been month no response.
I wonder how to deal when my kids faĺl sick

title: Speedy service
body: Started with a urine infection  . E consultation done a.m . Received a call back tge same morning  . Sample taken to the surgery same day. Results 2 days later

title: Lovely experience
body: Took my daughter for her pre school boosters, nurse was fabulous, staff have always been so helpful. Cannot fault the practice.

title: Excellent Practice
body: My family and I have been registered with KCPCC for many years and I continue to be pleased with the service they offer.  Very professional, helpful and caring and will always do their best for any condition we have contacted them about.  I cannot praise and thank the staff enough.

title: Reading reviews
body:
Guess not be getting help
Especially after receiving a Letter stating time to get the call.!!
Well seems clinic chose ring 2 hours early, missed 1st call 2nd call I picked up, caller put phone down.?
Rang centre, straight away.!,
Reception said shevEmail to whom suppose be calling me at designated time, let them no id called.
Time of call came and went!
Nearly 5 hours later I see missed call, was clinic?!

After reading reviews I'm even more stressed an anxious

title: Excellent Service
body: I had to have a Flexible Cystoscopy. I was very nervous but the clinician and nurses made feel comfortable. They were friendly but very professional. The clinician talked me through every step prior to  carrying it out so I knew what was happening. I can highly recommend the department very clean and well run.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent
body: The overall experience on the A&E I had was great. The staff was friendly and professional, the doctor took my concerns very seriously and did a scan. Thank you!

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Just terrible
body:
Over 10 days trying to phone. Get a system that works. Constantly engaged starting to think they switch the phones off. Finally got through to someone who was going to urgently get a doctor to call for a blood test. - never called back. Now I can’t get through again….. 

If you value your life go elsewhere

title: Outrageous
body: My Mum has been having pains in her chest and her arm so call for an ambulance,so far been waiting 5 hours and still not ambulance,keep calling and just keep getting told “we are very busy” well she could be very dead if she doesn’t get help!!!! I could have driven from London to Cornwall and taken her to hospital quicker!!!!!!

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very rude staff. Even the GP was rude.
body: Terrible experience. Rude, dismissive receptionists and even one of the Doctors was rude to me. It actually affected my mental health.

title: Prompt service
body: I was seen on the same day that I contacted the surgery, in spite of the current situation. I was satisfied with the consultation.

title: Caring practice
body: The practice has helped me through a very difficult period in my life , and has always met My medical needs but I agree, there must be a better way of reducing the phone waiting time

title: Awful front desk staff
body: The admin and reception staff at this practice are unprofessional, incompetent and incredibly rude.  On several occasions the staff fail to follow up on simple admin tasks when they commit to do so.  The staff are consistently rude and dismissive on the phone.  They don’t listen.  They are abrupt and unwilling to work together with you to resolve an issue or respond to a simple query.  My experience with the GPs and nurses has been very positive.  But, sadly, the reception staff are the entry point and the experience has become unbearable and unduly time consuming for patients to manage.

title: Great practice
body: I was in A&E for over 13 hours the staff were very consistent they left nothing unturned until I was given the correct Plan of care

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Absolutely disgusted !
body: Waited for more than 3 hours to see a doctor and at the end he recommend that I take some ibuprofen and paracetamol. I did however, explained to him that this is not helping. Apparently “hospital is unable to do blood test” which is a lot of none sense ! I think some of us will just drop dead in front of them then they will realised that we needed urgent care.

title: Frustrating GP Surgery!!
body: GP doesn’t listen properly & is always in a hurry with rushed appointments. It’s very much feels like we are an inconvenience to him especially now we ask for a home visit due to moms mobility issues. I have been dealing with this practice as POA for my mother since April 2020 & Staff are unable to understand the very simplest of  requests and updating records and taking notice of changes.  Practically every month of Repeat prescriptions there is an issue or something despite me clearly emailing my requests and receiving confirmation from them it is sorted when it has not been! It is then left up to me, wasting my time having to chase and speak with them again!  Then, they have the nerve to call me up to ask about it to see what the issue is.  It’s like banging your head against a brick wall. I am sure admin  staff do not communicate with each other and I am sure the GP is oblivious as to what is happening.   prescriptions have been done wrong, not done at all, been missed off, blaming the Chemist, blaming me - I am not impressed by their incompetence and inconsistencies and I am sure I could tell them till I am blue in the face & it would still be wrong.  No wonder I am extremely frustrated by their lack of care.  I feel very sorry indeed for those elderly patients who have no family to assist them -I dread to think  what’s happening to their medications. This surgery needs to get their act together!!

title: Completely pointless
body:
Yes the health service is under pressure, that's why we sit waiting with an emergency for 4 hours. But the utter uselessness of a so called professional in the ambulatory department, who told my family member after 4 hours they wouldn't even look at her emergency astounded me. 

This car crash of an emergency department needs gutting, completely unprofessional, and looking at other reviews I'm not alone in this opinion.

title: Couldn’t ask for more
body: I attended the Cardiac  Hub for a replacement pacemaker box. Not a pleasant procedure but the doctor and staff were marvellous. Can’t  name them all but thank you so much for looking after me.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Incredible kindness
body:
I had a surgery to save my baby - the care, kindness and professionalism I experienced left me in tears. I was informed at every step, cared for so tenderly and I really have no idea how such a collective of wonderful humans remain cheery despite the backdrop of a pandemic. I will never stop being grateful for the care I recieved - it was, in every way, above and beyond a job description. 
 I pray the NHS and its members get the pay rises, reduction in working hours and the governmental support they need.
